techmeme.title: A Columbia student suspended over a tool to cheat on job interviews says he's raised a $5.3M seed for Cluely, which offers an AI tool to "cheat on everything" (Charles Rollet/TechCrunch)
The US v. Google remedies trial opens with the DOJ arguing that Google should be forced to divest Chrome, and Google calling the proposed remedies "extreme" (Julian Mark/Washington Post)
Circle unveils a network designed to link financial institutions and enable real-time settlement of cross-border payments, starting with USDC and EURC in May (Emily Mason/Bloomberg)
Microsoft has improved Recall, but biometrics are only required for setup and users can open it with just a PIN, and sensitive data filtering is unreliable (Kevin Beaumont/DoublePulsar)
Judge Questions Chrome Divestiture Idea (Erin Woo/The Information)
